newsitem.title: MALTA: Malta's weekly exchange closes in quiet trading.
newsitem.headline: Malta's weekly exchange closes in quiet trading.

text.p: Trading was quiet on the Malta stock exchange in its once weekly trading session on Wednesday, although average prices of equities were slightly up.
Turnover on Wednesday reached just under 400,000 Malta pounds ($1.03m) compared to 9.5 million pounds the previous week.

In equities, turnover totalled 150,330 pounds, with 113,954 shares changing hands. Bank of Valletta accounted for the biggest share of trading, with 94,664 changing hands in 43 deals for an average of 129.6 cents per share, a gain of eight mils from the previous week.
In Mid-Med Bank 6,550 shares changed hands in seven deals for an average 160.6 cents, up 2.6c.

Lombard Bank Malta shares gained 1c.9 with 10,240 shares selling in 10 deals for an average 151.9c. There was no change in Farsons ordinary shares, with 4,000 selling for an average of 50 cents in two deals. But Farsons 8.5 percent preference shares lost 1.6c with just over 4,000 shares selling in nine deals for an average of 96.4c.
Turnover in Malta government bonds reached 173,639 pounds with trading in 12 securities while trading in corporate bonds reached 67,701 pounds.
The share index gained 11.44 points to close at 1020.57.
